snippet: The continued presence of troops in Wardak, against the wishes of the Afghan government, brought demonstrators to Kabul on Saturday and provoked a  denunciation from Muslim clerics.
abstract: Continued presence of American Special Operations troops in Wardak Province, against wishes of Afghan government, brings demonstrators to capital and provokes strongly worded denunciation from Muslim clerics.

byline.contributor: Sangar Rahimi contributed reporting from Kabul, Taimoor Shah from Kandahar, Afghanistan, and Thom Shanker from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The continued presence of troops in Wardak, against the wishes of the Afghan government, brought demonstrators to Kabul on Saturday and provoked a  denunciation from Muslim clerics.

headline.seo: Objections to U.S. Troops Intensify in Afghanistan
headline.main: Objections to U.S. Troops Intensify in Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Objections to U.S. Troops Intensify in Afghanistan
